# Locale.IdentifierType.cldr

**Case**

The type of identifiers that follow CLDR (Common Locale Data Repository) conventions.

## Declaration

```swift
case cldr
```

## Discussion

The components in this type of identifier use the same components as in [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/IdentifierType/icu], but don’t use the key-value type keyword list. An example of this type is `th_TH_u_ca_gregory_nu_thai`.

## Standard Identifier Types

- **Locale.IdentifierType.icu**: The type of identifiers that follow ICU (International Components for Unicode) conventions.
- **Locale.IdentifierType.bcp47**: The type of BCP 47 language identifiers.
